definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: The life imbroglio of his home, he resembles a waifs and strays same.
sentences.chinese: 他家的生活一團糟，他就像個流浪兒一樣。

sentences.english: He has been a waif for many years.
sentences.chinese: 街上有一個流浪兒正在乞討。

sentences.english: Benedict recalled the plight of "street children who do not have the blessing of a family home."
sentences.chinese: 教皇提醒信徒不要忘記那些無家可歸的流浪兒的處境。

sentences.english: The kind-hearted old couple adopted the street urchin to be their adoptive son.
sentences.chinese: 善良的老夫婦將那個流浪兒收爲義子。

sentences.english: He said they were living like vagabonds.
sentences.chinese: 他說他們以前就像流浪兒一樣生活。

sentences.english: Will you care for the waifs?
A waif is begging on the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上有一個流浪兒正在乞討。
